attributes.gen_ai.operation.name: invoke_agent
attributes.gen_ai.agent.name: Strands Agents
attributes.system_prompt:
You are the SUMMARY AGENT.

You take:
- search_result: the raw results from search_agent (contains URLs & policy types)
- extraction_result: the structured extracted points from extract_agent
- user_query: what the user is asking for (e.g., "data collection practices")

Your job is to generate a FINAL TRANSPARENT SUMMARY with the following goals:

1. Summarize the company's data practices clearly and concisely.
2. Provide a multi-dimensional rating system:
   - data_collection_risk: 1–5
   - data_sharing_risk: 1–5
   - tracking_risk: 1–5
   - transparency_score: 1–5
3. Explain WHY you assigned each rating.
   - Refer EXPLICITLY to specific extracted_points and their source URLs.
4. Provide user safety guidance:
   - How users can protect themselves on this platform.
   - What settings they can change.
   - What rights they have (e.g. delete data, opt-out of tracking).
5. Provide a final consumer-friendly summary:
   - “Should users be concerned?”
   - “How careful should users be?”
6. List all sources used, with URLs and relevance.

STRICT OUTPUT FORMAT:
{
  "status": "success" | "error",
  "query": "<original query>",
  "summary": {
    "overview": "<plain-language high-level summary>",
    "key_findings": ["...", "..."],
    "ratings": {
      "data_collection_risk": <1-5>,
      "data_sharing_risk": <1-5>,
      "tracking_risk": <1-5>,
      "transparency_score": <1-5>
    },
    "reasoning": [
      {
        "rating": "<which rating>",
        "evidence": [
          {
            "url": "<source url>",
            "point": "<specific extracted_point from extraction_result>"
          }
        ],
        "explanation": "<why this evidence led to the rating>"
      }
    ],
    "user_protection_advice": ["...", "..."],
    "final_recommendation": "<string>"
  },
  "sources_used": [
    {
      "url": "<string>",
      "policy_type": "<string>",
      "relevance": <float>,
      "title": "<string or null>"
    }
  ],
  "error_message": "<null or string>"
}

RULES:
- No markdown.
- No code fences.
- Citations MUST reference actual URLs from search_result.
- Evidence MUST reference extracted_points from extraction_result.
- If extraction_result.status != success → return status:error.

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs: {"status": "success", "query": "Summarize Anthropic's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).", "summary": {"overview": "Anthropic's privacy policies for its consumer products (Claude Free, Pro, Max) have recently been updated, notably shifting to an opt-out model for using user chats and coding sessions for AI model training. If users opt-in (by not opting out), data retention for these sessions extends significantly from 30 days to five years. Anthropic states it does not sell user data to third parties and employs filtering for sensitive information. For commercial services (Claude for Work, API), these specific model training updates do not apply. Anthropic also uses various cookies for website functionality, analytics, and marketing.", "key_findings": ["Anthropic's consumer products (Claude Free, Pro, Max) now use user chats and coding sessions for AI model training by default for existing users (opt-out required) and as a selectable option for new users.", "If users opt-in to model training, the data retention period for these chats and coding sessions is extended to five years; otherwise, it remains 30 days.", "Deleted conversations are not used for future model training, and Anthropic claims to filter or obfuscate sensitive data.", "Anthropic explicitly states it does not sell user data to third parties.", "These data handling updates for model training and retention do not apply to commercial services like Claude for Work or API use.", "Anthropic uses necessary, analytics (e.g., Google Analytics, LinkedIn), and marketing cookies (e.g., Google Advertising, Facebook, Reddit, TikTok, Twitter) on its websites for functionality, performance analysis, and targeted reporting.", "Users have controls to manage cookie preferences via 'Privacy Choices' links and can also manage model improvement settings, delete accounts, and export data."], "ratings": {"data_collection_risk": 3, "data_sharing_risk": 2, "tracking_risk": 3, "transparency_score": 3}, "reasoning": [{"rating": "data_collection_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms", "point": "Users can choose to allow chats and coding sessions for AI model training (opt-out by default for existing users, selectable for new users)."}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use", "point": "Anthropic uses necessary, analytics, and marketing cookies on its websites."}, {"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms", "point": "Anthropic filters/obfuscates sensitive data."}], "explanation": "Anthropic collects user-generated content (chats, coding sessions) which can contain highly personal or sensitive information, and uses it for AI model training by default for existing users unless they opt-out. While they claim to filter sensitive data, the nature of the data collected and its use for training models presents a moderate risk. Additionally, they collect data via analytics and marketing cookies."}, {"rating": "data_sharing_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms", "point": "Anthropic does not sell user data to third parties."}, {"url": "https://techcrunch.com/2025/08/28/anthropic-users-face-a-new-choice-opt-out-or-share-your-data-for-ai-training/", "point": "Anthropic states data will not be sold to third parties and sensitive data will be filtered."}], "explanation": "Anthropic explicitly states that it does not sell user data to third parties. While data is used for internal model training and likely shared with service providers for operational purposes (as is standard for most online services), the clear statement against selling data reduces the overall data sharing risk."}, {"rating": "tracking_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use", "point": "Analytics cookies (e.g., Google Analytics, LinkedIn) are used for performance enhancement by analyzing website traffic and user interaction."}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use", "point": "Marketing cookies (e.g., Google Advertising, Facebook, Reddit, TikTok, Twitter) are used for targeted marketing and aggregated reporting."}], "explanation": "Anthropic uses analytics and marketing cookies, including those from major advertising platforms like Google, Facebook, and TikTok. This indicates tracking for website traffic analysis, user interaction, and targeted marketing, which represents a moderate level of tracking risk."}, {"rating": "transparency_score", "evidence": [{"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms", "point": "Anthropic updated Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy for Claude Free, Pro, and Max plans."}, {"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms", "point": "Users can choose to allow chats and coding sessions for AI model training (opt-out by default for existing users, selectable for new users)."}, {"url": "https://privacy.claude.com/en/collections/10663362-consumers", "point": "This page is a central hub in Anthropic's Privacy Center for consumer privacy information (Claude Free, Pro, Max)."}, {"url": "https://techcrunch.com/2025/08/28/anthropic-users-face-a-new-choice-opt-out-or-share-your-data-for-ai-training/", "point": "The shift is seen as an industry trend but raises concerns about user consent due to the default opt-in setting."}], "explanation": "Anthropic has clearly communicated its policy updates through official channels and provides a dedicated Privacy Center. They offer users a choice regarding model training data. However, the default opt-out setting for existing users for model training, which significantly extends data retention, could be easily overlooked by users, potentially leading to unintended data sharing and longer retention. This practical aspect of user consent reduces the overall transparency score despite clear documentation."}], "user_protection_advice": ["If you are an existing Anthropic consumer user (Claude Free, Pro, Max), actively review your privacy settings and ensure you opt-out of using your chats and coding sessions for AI model training if you do not wish for your data to be used for this purpose and retained for five years.", "Be aware that if you opt-out of model training, your data retention period for chats and coding sessions will be 30 days, compared to five years if you remain opted-in.", "Regularly delete conversations you wish to remove, as deleted conversations are not used for future model training.", "Utilize the 'Privacy Choices' links on anthropic.com and claude.ai to manage your cookie preferences, especially for analytics and marketing cookies.", "For commercial users (Claude for Work, API access), understand that the consumer-specific model training policies do not apply to your data.", "Be mindful of the content you share in chats and coding sessions, even with claims of sensitive data filtering, as personal information could still be processed."], "final_recommendation": "Users should be moderately concerned about their privacy with Anthropic's consumer products, primarily due to the recent shift to an opt-out model for AI model training and the significantly extended data retention (five years) if users do not actively opt-out. While Anthropic provides clear policies and controls, the default setting for existing users means many may unknowingly contribute their data for model training. Users should be careful to review and adjust their privacy settings, especially regarding model training, and manage their cookie preferences to protect their data."}, "sources_used": [{"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/news/updates-to-our-consumer-terms", "policy_type": "privacy_policy", "relevance": 0.98, "title": "Updates to Consumer Terms and Privacy Policy \\\\ Anthropic"}, {"url": "https://privacy.claude.com/en/articles/10301952-updates-to-our-privacy-policy", "policy_type": "privacy_policy", "relevance": 0.97, "title": "Updates to our Privacy Policy | Anthropic Privacy Center"}, {"url": "https://support.anthropic.com/en/articles/9020432-what-cookies-does-anthropic-use", "policy_type": "cookie_policy", "relevance": 0.95, "title": "What Cookies Does Anthropic Use? | Anthropic Help Center"}, {"url": "https://techcrunch.com/2025/08/28/anthropic-users-face-a-new-choice-opt-out-or-share-your-data-for-ai-training/", "policy_type": "data_protection", "relevance": 0.9, "title": "Anthropic users face a new choice – opt out or share your chats for AI training | TechCrunch"}, {"url": "https://www.anthropic.com/startup-program-official-terms", "policy_type": "terms_of_service", "relevance": 0.85, "title": "Startup Program Official Terms \\\\ Anthropic"}, {"url": "https://privacy.claude.com/en/collections/10663362-consumers", "policy_type": "other", "relevance": 0.8, "title": "Consumers | Anthropic Privacy Center"}], "error_message": null}

attributes.content: [{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Google\", \"resolved_domain\": \"google.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy \\u2013 Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"Google collects information to provide and improve its services, including data you provide (name, password, phone, payment info, content you create), information from your apps, browsers, and devices (unique identifiers, settings, IP address, crash reports), your activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice info, purchase activity, communication, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices). Data is used for service provision, maintenance, improvement, new service development, personalization (content and ads), performance measurement, communication, and protection against fraud and security issues. Google does not sell personal information. Information is shared with consent, with domain administrators, for external processing, and for legal reasons. Data is retained for varying periods, with options for users to delete or auto-delete certain data. Google employs security measures like encryption and access restrictions. Users have controls to manage, review, update, export, and delete their information through their Google Account, Activity Controls, Ad settings, and browser/device settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.98, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the official and comprehensive Google Privacy Policy, directly addressing all aspects of data collection, usage, sharing, retention, and user rights.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://safety.google/privacy/data/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"Your privacy is protected by responsible data practices.\", \"summary\": \"Google emphasizes its commitment to privacy by design, stating it never sells personal information and is transparent about data collection and usage. It provides users with easy controls to manage their data, including reviewing, downloading, and deleting it. Google protects data with advanced security infrastructures and continuously innovates privacy technologies, sharing them with others. Data minimization practices include auto-deletion of Location History and Web & App Activity after 18 months by default for new accounts. Users can view and delete data through Dashboard and My Activity, and export their data. Google complies with applicable data protection laws and works with regulatory authorities.\", \"relevance\": 0.95, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page directly addresses Google's data protection principles, practices, and user controls, providing a high-level overview of their approach to privacy and data handling.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://transparency.google/intl/en_us/our-policies/privacy-policy-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and AI - Transparency Center\", \"summary\": \"This page from Google's Transparency Center outlines their commitment to user privacy and security, guided by Privacy and Security Principles. It explains what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review, update, or remove their data. It also mentions the Google API Services User Data Policy, which focuses on privacy and security requirements for developers using Google APIs. Additionally, it touches upon Google's approach to responsible AI development and related privacy hubs and policies for Gemini Apps and Generative AI, including restrictions on content creation and distribution.\", \"relevance\": 0.9, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page provides a good overview of Google's privacy policy, terms of service, and specific policies related to AI, acting as a central hub for understanding their data practices.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"This is the main hub for Google's Privacy & Terms, providing an overview of what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review and update it. It links to the full Privacy Policy and Terms of Service. The page also highlights the Google Safety Center, Google Account for managing privacy, and Google's Privacy and Security Principles. It emphasizes user control over personal information and usage history across various Google products like Gmail, Search, and YouTube.\", \"relevance\": 0.85, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the overarching page for Google's privacy and terms, serving as an entry point to more detailed policies. It provides a good summary of their privacy principles and links to relevant resources.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 1}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"task_prompt\": \"privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices\", \"results\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"content_summary\": \"This Google Privacy Policy outlines what information Google collects, why it collects it, and how users can update, manage, export, and delete their information. It applies to all services offered by Google LLC and its affiliates, including YouTube and Android, and services on third-party sites. The policy also addresses compliance with European Union and United Kingdom data protection laws, detailing user rights and Google's obligations.\", \"extracted_points\": [\"Google collects information to provide, maintain, and improve its services, develop new offerings, and personalize user experiences, including content and ads.\", \"Data is also used to measure performance, communicate with users, and protect Google, its users, and the public from fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues.\", \"Information collected includes data provided by users (name, password, phone, payment, content), data from apps/browsers/devices (unique identifiers, IP address, crash reports), user activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice, purchases, communications, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices).\", \"Information is also collected from publicly accessible sources and trusted partners (directory services, marketing, security partners).\", \"Data collection technologies include cookies, pixel tags, local storage, databases, and server logs.\", \"User privacy controls are available through Google Account settings (Activity Controls, Ad settings, About you, Shared endorsements), Privacy Checkup, My Activity, Google Dashboard, and device/browser settings.\", \"Information sharing occurs with user consent, with domain administrators, for external processing by trusted parties, and for legal reasons (law, regulation, legal process, governmental requests, Terms of Service enforcement, fraud/security protection, public safety). Non-personally identifiable information may be shared publicly with partners.\", \"Security measures include encryption for data in transit, security features (Safe Browsing, 2 Step Verification), review of data practices, physical security, and restricted access to personal information for authorized personnel.\", \"Users can export a copy of their data or delete content from specific services, items from My Activity, specific products, or their entire Google Account. An Inactive Account Manager allows designated access.\", \"Data retention varies: some data is kept until deleted by the user or auto-deleted, some is deleted/anonymized automatically after a set period, some is kept until account deletion, and some is retained longer for legitimate business or legal purposes (security, fraud prevention, financial records). A deletion process ensures safe removal, with potential delays.\", \"Google will not reduce user rights under this Privacy Policy without explicit consent.\", \"Personalized ads are not shown based on sensitive categories (race, religion, sexual orientation, health) or content from Drive, Gmail, or Photos.\", \"Personally identifiable information is not shared with advertisers unless explicitly requested by the user.\", \"Explicit consent is required before using information for purposes not covered in the Privacy Policy.\", \"Google complies with applicable data protection laws, including EU and UK regulations, and provides mechanisms for users to exercise their rights.\", \"Data processing is based on legal grounds such as contract performance, legitimate interests, vital interests, legal obligations, or user consent.\", \"Google (Google Ireland Limited for EEA/Switzerland, Google LLC for UK and global Search/Maps) acts as the data controller, responsible for processing information and complying with privacy laws.\", \"Users are responsible for managing their privacy settings and exercising their rights to control, review, update, export, and delete their information.\", \"Domain administrators (for organizational accounts) have access to and control over user accounts, including the ability to access/retain information, view statistics, change passwords, suspend/terminate access, and restrict data management options.\", \"Affiliates and trusted third-party businesses process personal information on Google's behalf, adhering to Google's instructions, Privacy Policy, and confidentiality/security measures.\", \"Partners (publishers, advertisers, developers, rights holders) may collect information from user browsers/devices for advertising and measurement purposes, or receive non-personally identifiable information from Google.\", \"Google continuously works to detect, prevent, and respond to fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues that could harm Google, its users, or the public.\", \"The policy is regularly reviewed for compliance, and Google processes information in ways that adhere to it.\", \"Data transfers occur globally, with the same protections applied regardless of server location, and Google complies with legal frameworks for data transfer.\", \"For EU/UK users, Google provides controls to exercise rights (access, update, remove, restrict processing, object, export) and offers contact points for questions or concerns, including local data protection authorities.\", \"Google responds to formal written complaints and cooperates with regulatory authorities to resolve data transfer issues.\", \"Personal information is shared for legal reasons, including responding to applicable laws, regulations, legal processes, or enforceable governmental requests, with details published in a Transparency Report.\", \"Google analyzes content to detect abuse (spam, malware, illegal content) and may disable accounts or report violations to authorities. Age verification processes are in place to ensure users meet service requirements.\", \"The Privacy Policy is effective July 1, 2025, with archived versions available.\", \"Key terms such as 'Affiliates', 'Algorithm', 'Cookies', 'Personal information', and 'Sensitive personal information' are defined within the policy.\", \"Specific privacy notices are provided for various Google services like Payments, Fiber, Gemini Apps, YouTube Kids, and Google Workspace for Education.\", \"Additional resources are available, including Your Google Account, Privacy Checkup, Google\\u2019s safety center, Google\\u2019s Teen Privacy Guide, and information on technologies used.\", \"Changes to the policy will not reduce user rights without explicit consent, and significant changes will be communicated with prominent notice.\", \"EU users have choices regarding linking certain Google services.\"], \"relevance\": 0.98}], \"error_message\": null}, \"query\": \"Summarize Google's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]

[{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Meta\", \"resolved_domain\": \"meta.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://www.whatsapp.com/legal/privacy-policy?lang=en&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy\", \"summary\": \"WhatsApp collects account information (phone number, profile name), messages (stored encrypted temporarily for delivery, then deleted), connections (address book contacts), status information, and customer support communications. Automatically collected data includes usage and log information (activity, settings, interactions, time, frequency, duration), device and connection information (hardware, OS, battery, signal, app version, IP address, identifiers), and location information (precise with permission, general from IP). Third parties provide information about users (e.g., contacts from other users, user reports). Information is used to operate, provide, improve, customize, support, and market services, including connecting with other Meta Company Products. WhatsApp shares information with those you communicate with, and with third-party service providers and other Meta Companies for infrastructure, marketing, research, security, and customer service. WhatsApp emphasizes end-to-end encryption for messages and calls. Users can manage and delete their information through in-app settings, including deleting their account.\", \"relevance\": 0.98, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the official and comprehensive privacy policy for WhatsApp, a major Meta product, detailing data collection, usage, sharing, and user controls.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.facebook.com/privacy/policy/\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Meta Privacy Policy - How Meta Collects and Uses User Data\", \"summary\": \"Meta collects information about users and their activity on and off Facebook and Instagram, including content provided (posts, likes, comments, connections, transactions), information from other people (tags), and device information (identifiers, cookies, camera, microphone, location). This data is used to provide personalized experiences, content, and ad recommendations, and for research and development. Meta's privacy policy updates focus on clarifying how data is used, particularly with interactions with Meta AI, and emphasizes that private messages with friends and family are not used to train AIs unless explicitly shared. Users have controls to manage their privacy settings, including who sees their posts and ad topics.\", \"relevance\": 0.97, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the main privacy policy for Meta's core platforms like Facebook and Instagram, covering broad data practices, even if the full content wasn't directly provided in the search results, its scope is clear from related snippets.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.meta.com/legal/privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Privacy Policy | Meta | Meta Store\", \"summary\": \"This supplemental privacy policy details data collection for Meta accounts and Meta VR Products (e.g., Quest devices). For Meta accounts, it collects name, contact info, password, date of birth, and username. For VR products, it collects information about connections, physical characteristics and movements (headset position, controller speed, audio data for avatar animation), hand/body/eye tracking data (processed on device), Meta VR Product activity (payments, events, purchases, app usage, time/frequency/duration), content created, fitness information (calories, activity, goals), gameplay statistics, environmental information, and camera/audio information (raw images processed on device, recorded audio in Worlds if microphone on, crash logs). Voice conversations with Meta AI are also processed. Device information and data from partners/third parties are collected. This data is used to provide social features, personalize content and ads, and improve Meta VR Products. Information is shared with organizations managing Meta accounts, and with third-party services and partners.\", \"relevance\": 0.96, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This policy is highly relevant as it specifically addresses data collection and usage for Meta's VR/AR hardware and associated services, providing detailed insights into biometric and activity data.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.facebook.com/terms/\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Meta Terms of Service\", \"summary\": \"Meta's Terms of Service outline the agreement between users and Meta Platforms, Inc. for using Facebook and other covered products and services. By using these apps, users agree to these terms. The terms include specific explanations regarding the misuse of Meta's apps and data scraping, clarifying that automated data collection without permission is prohibited, even when logged in. It also includes qualifiers for Avatar and AI use, referencing separate supplemental terms for these features, which cover the use of personal data inputs (e.g., selfie videos for avatar creation, AI chat conversations shared with third parties for search results or internal reviews). The terms also consolidate Community Standards for Facebook, Messenger, Instagram, and Threads into a central location.\", \"relevance\": 0.95, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the main terms of service for Meta's core platforms, outlining user agreements, acceptable use, and references to data handling in the context of platform usage.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.meta.com/legal/supplemental-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Terms Of Service | Meta Quest | Meta Store\", \"summary\": \"These supplemental terms apply to Meta Platforms Technologies (MPT) Products, including Meta VR Products. Users must be at least 13 (or 10-12 with parental account management) to create an account and must provide accurate, up-to-date personal data. Users are responsible for their own and other users' (including children's) activities on their MPT Products, and for complying with privacy laws regarding recording and biometric data. Users grant Meta permission to use their name, profile picture, and actions with ads and sponsored content in MPT Products and across Meta Company Products if accounts are connected. The terms detail licenses for software and content, and the use of third-party services, which are subject to their own terms. Meta may change or limit functionality and updates these terms periodically, with continued use signifying acceptance. It also includes an arbitration notice, waiving rights to jury trials and class actions for certain disputes.\", \"relevance\": 0.94, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This document provides specific terms of service for Meta's hardware products, including important details on account requirements, user responsibilities, data permissions, and dispute resolution.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://about.instagram.com/data-policy?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"About Instagram's Data Policy\", \"summary\": \"Instagram collects information about users and their activity, both on and off Facebook and Instagram. This includes content provided (posts, likes, comments), connections, transactions, usage of products, information from other people (tags), and device information (identifiers, cookies, camera, microphone, location). Data is also collected from partners (websites visited, apps used, purchases). This information is used to provide a personalized experience, improve services, and for market research. Instagram shares data with people and accounts based on audience choices and settings, with services users grant access to, with advertisers to measure ad effectiveness, with companies offering products through Instagram, with vendors and service providers, and with researchers. Data can be accessed and downloaded, and users can delete posts or temporarily disable/delete their account, though information shared by others about them is not deleted.\", \"relevance\": 0.93, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the official data policy for Instagram, a key Meta platform, providing a clear overview of data collection, usage, sharing, and user controls specific to Instagram.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.meta.com/legal/portal/data-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"Supplemental Portal Data Policy | Meta Portal | Meta Store\", \"summary\": \"This policy outlines data collection for Meta Portal devices. It collects camera and audio information (technical call info, Smart Camera processing on device for framing, voice interactions including wake words, audio recordings, and transcripts for service improvement), environmental data (ambient light), device performance and reliability data (crash reports, system logs), information and content provided directly to the device (names, contacts, photos, videos, drawings), and information about third-party service usage. This data is used to detect engagement, regulate device performance, improve reliability, and offer/improve voice services. Information is shared with people with physical access to the device, with third parties for product improvement and legal compliance (e.g., vendors for speech recognition), and with third parties to facilitate their services on Portal devices (e.g., device name, IP address, zip code). Users can manage privacy settings and are informed about consumer privacy rights.\", \"relevance\": 0.92, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This policy is highly relevant as it provides specific and detailed data practices for Meta Portal devices, including sensitive data like camera, audio, and voice interactions.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://opensource.fb.com/legal/privacy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy | Meta Open Source\", \"summary\": \"Meta Open Source collects information users provide directly (contact info, correspondence) and automatically (device attributes, operations, identifiers, network and connections, video/text content from apps). Cookies and similar technologies (Google Analytics) are used to understand service usage. Information is used to provide, personalize, and improve services, promote safety and security, and for other disclosed purposes. Data is shared with service providers (hosting, communications, analytics), for legal purposes (subpoenas, fraud detection), in business transfers, and with user consent. Meta does not knowingly collect information from children under 13. Data is retained until no longer necessary for the collected purposes, with longer retention for legal or safety reasons. Users in the European Region and UK have specific rights (data portability, access, rectify, erase, object, restrict processing) and can contact Meta Platforms Ireland Ltd. or Meta Platforms, Inc. respectively.\", \"relevance\": 0.88, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is an official privacy policy from Meta, specifically for its open-source initiatives, providing details on data collection, usage, sharing, and retention in that context.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://about.fb.com/news/2022/05/metas-updated-privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Here's What You Need to Know About Our Updated Privacy Policy and Terms of Service\", \"summary\": \"This Meta newsroom article announces updates to Meta's Privacy Policy and Terms of Service, emphasizing that the changes aim for clearer communication about data practices without altering how data is collected, used, or shared. It highlights Meta's commitment to personalized experiences with strong data protections and transparency. The update includes new audience controls for Facebook posts and consolidated ad topic and interest category controls across Facebook and Instagram. It also introduces the Privacy Center as a hub for privacy questions, controls, and security tips, reflecting Meta's response to user feedback and evolving regulations.\", \"relevance\": 0.85, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This newsroom article provides valuable context and an overview of Meta's privacy policy updates and their intentions, including new features for user control.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 2}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"task_prompt\": \"privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices\", \"results\": [{\"url\": \"https://safety.google/privacy/data/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"content_summary\": \"This document from Google's Safety Center outlines Google's privacy practices and protections, emphasizing a 'Safer by Design' approach. It details core privacy principles, the use of privacy-preserving technologies, and product-specific safeguards. The policy highlights Google's commitment to transparency, user control, and data minimization, ensuring personal information is respected and protected.\", \"extracted_points\": [\"Google builds products that are private by design for everyone, being thoughtful about data use and protection.\", \"Google never sells personal information to anyone, including for advertising purposes.\", \"Google is transparent about what data it collects and why, making this information easy to find and understand.\", \"Google makes it easy for users to control their personal information, allowing them to review, download, move, or delete data.\", \"Google reduces the data it uses to further protect privacy, never using content from Drive, Gmail, or Photos for advertising.\", \"Google does not Google One, Pixel, Family Link, Google Pay, Search, Fitbit, Maps, YouTube, Gemini, and Meet.\", \"Users can access Ad Settings, Security Settings, Privacy Settings, and Parental Controls to customize their experiences.\"], \"relevance\": 0.95}, {\"url\": \"https://transparency.google/intl/en_us/our-policies/privacy-policy-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\",
